channel.title: How does Gordon have a HUD if he doesn't have a helmet?
channel.description:
Just out of plain curiousity how does Gordon see how much health he has or his suit functions because I doubt his glasses can zoom in like that
If you notice in either HL game the suit doesn't have a helmet......
I mean how has no one noticed this and his reflexes must be olympian to have dodged literally over a thousand headcrabs. He doesn't even have a beanie like the other rebels he just has a stern expression a pair of glasses and a cool beard
Also no one better ban me for questioning our God because that would really suck
LOOK AT IT! :freeman: :freeman: :freeman: :freeman: :freeman: JUST LOOK AT IT!

item.title: How does Gordon have a HUD if he doesn't have a helmet?
item.dc:creator: Crikulus
item.description:
Three words that apply to black mesa: Infinite Aux Power…

Read full topic
item.source: How does Gordon have a HUD if he doesn't have a helmet?

item.title: How does Gordon have a HUD if he doesn't have a helmet?
item.dc:creator: YARO
item.description:
Hmm, so the real question is: if the flashlight could regenerate its own battery then why HEV couldn’t?

Read full topic
item.source: How does Gordon have a HUD if he doesn't have a helmet?

item.title: How does Gordon have a HUD if he doesn't have a helmet?
item.dc:creator: Dias
item.description:
NickAVV:

hud flickered

It would either fade out, or turn off instantly. It’s loosing power, not breaking.

Grey Acumen:

Removing the entire hud would be a bit much though, but leaving the crosshairs along with the health and ammo monitor while taking the rest of the hud away when at 0 hev power could be neat.

So it’s just the weapon select that gets hidden?
Or does the auxiliary power & flashlight get hidden too?
Or does the auxiliary power not work because the primary power is out?
Or should the armor power regenerate when the auxiliary power isn’t being used?
Or should the armor power drain when the auxiliary power runs out?

Or how about not punishing the player for being bad at the game by making it harder? Or trying to change the mechanics of the game to fit some unexplained sci-fi logic that only exists to justify the game mechanics to begin with? Or does that just make too much sense?

Read full topic
item.source: How does Gordon have a HUD if he doesn't have a helmet?

item.title: How does Gordon have a HUD if he doesn't have a helmet?
item.dc:creator: YourArcenist
item.description:
Soviet:

I think the most reasonable explanation would be that he’s GORDON FUCKING FREEMAN.

Agreed

Read full topic
item.source: How does Gordon have a HUD if he doesn't have a helmet?

item.title: How does Gordon have a HUD if he doesn't have a helmet?
item.dc:creator: Grey_Acumen
item.description:
actually, I really like the idea. In order to use the HUD you actually need to have suit power. Removing the entire hud would be a bit much though, but leaving the crosshairs along with the health and ammo monitor while taking the rest of the hud away when at 0 hev power could be neat.

Read full topic

item.title: How does Gordon have a HUD if he doesn't have a helmet?

item.description:
I know your supposed to be looking through gordon’s eyes, but I always thought of it as the HUD was just a visual way to show gordon’s mind’s inventory on ammo and stuff. As for the Homing signal in ep2, I haven’t really thought about it.

Has anyone considered the possibility that there is in fact no HUD, but instead exists a representation of what Gordon is aware of.

That’s all you need to know .

item.source: How does Gordon have a HUD if he doesn't have a helmet?

item.title: How does Gordon have a HUD if he doesn't have a helmet?
item.dc:creator: baconeggs
item.description:
Has anyone considered the possibility that there is in fact no HUD, but instead exists a representation of what Gordon is aware of. The player can’t feel the same things as Gordon, so things how hurt he is (health) are shown visually. I always assumed that the HUD didn’t exist in the actual world but was instead a representation of status for the benefit of the player.

Read full topic
item.source: How does Gordon have a HUD if he doesn't have a helmet?

item.title: How does Gordon have a HUD if he doesn't have a helmet?
item.dc:creator: Orpheon
item.description:
I’d also like to point out that Gordon doesn’t have legs and apparently can just float up ladders while something, probably his beard, makes a banging sound against the rungs.

Translation: It’s a game, they do things to make it easier to play. Only questions about the actual content of the game are valid.

Read full topic
